page.title: 19The Homestead : Clifton
page.content: The Homestead is a large garden in Clifton belonging to the Joseph Rowntree Trust and is open to the public.It is named after a farm where Ouse Lea is now.Mr Alcorn the Rowntree Trust Head Gardener told us that it cost about fifty to sixty thousand pounds a year to run.The gardens have been here about fifty years and originally belonged to the house which is now Rowntree's European Office.The Homestead has five full-time gardeners and eleven part-timers who work in other areas also.As well as lawns, trees, flower beds and picnic areas, there are swings roundabouts and other amusements for children in the gardens .The Board of Trustees listen to the ideas of the public and then decide what amusements are provided.Mr Alcorn said that all kinds and ages of people come to the Homestead .
